text: Dwayne "D. J." King (born June 27, 1984) is a Canadian former professional ice hockey left winger who played in the National Hockey League (NHL) with the St. Louis Blues and the Washington Capitals. Before playing in the NHL, King played 4 seasons in the Western Hockey League; 3 seasons with the Lethbridge Hurricanes and 1 season with the Kelowna Rockets. He was drafted by the St. Louis Blues with the 190th overall pick in the 2002 NHL Entry Draft. King is of MÃ©tis heritage. He has a younger brother named Dwight, that plays for the Los Angeles Kings. ==References== ==Other websites== * * Category:1984 births Category:Living people Category:Canadian ice hockey left wingers Category:Hershey Bears players Category:Ice hockey people from Saskatchewan Category:Lethbridge Hurricanes players Category:Peoria Rivermen (AHL) players Category:St. Louis Blues players Category:Washington Capitals players Category:Worcester IceCats players Category:ECHL players Category:Memorial Cup winners
title: D. J. King
